name: MolecularSequence
title: MolecularSequence
description: Raw data describing a biological sequence.

elements.name: MolecularSequence
elements.description: Raw data describing a biological sequence.

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: A unique identifier for this particular sequence instance.

elements.name: type
elements.description: Amino Acid Sequence/ DNA Sequence / RNA Sequence.

elements.name: coordinateSystem
elements.description: Whether the sequence is numbered starting at 0 (0-based numbering or coordinates, inclusive start, exclusive end) or starting at 1 (1-based numbering, inclusive start and inclusive end).

elements.name: patient
elements.description: The patient whose sequencing results are described by this resource.

elements.name: device
elements.description: The method for sequencing, for example, chip information.

elements.name: performer
elements.description: The organization or lab that should be responsible for this result.

elements.name: quantity
elements.description: The number of copies of the sequence of interest.

elements.name: referenceSeq
elements.description: A sequence that is used as a reference to describe variants that are present in a sequence analyzed.

elements.name: variant
elements.description: The definition of variant here originates from Sequence ontology ([variant_of](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/variant_of)).

elements.name: quality
elements.description: An experimental feature attribute that defines the quality of the feature in a quantitative way, such as a phred quality score ([SO:0001686](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/SO:0001686)).

elements.name: readCoverage
elements.description: Coverage (read depth or depth) is the average number of reads representing a given nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence.

elements.name: pointer
elements.description: Pointer to next atomic sequence which at most contains one variant.
